name: biomni-model-bacterial-growth-dynamics
title: Biomni: Model Bacterial Growth Dynamics
description: Model bacterial population dynamics over time using ordinary differential equations
content:
Overview

Models bacterial population dynamics over time using ordinary differential equations (ODEs) that incorporate growth, death/clearance, and carrying capacity effects. This mathematical modeling tool simulates bacterial population changes under various conditions, accounting for logistic growth patterns, environmental constraints, and host immune responses. The model provides insights into bacterial behavior in complex biological systems.

Input Parameters

  • initial_population (required): Starting bacterial population size (cells or CFU)
  • growth_rate (required): Intrinsic bacterial growth rate per hour (r parameter)
  • clearance_rate (required): Rate of bacterial clearance or death per hour (d parameter)
  • niche_size (required): Carrying capacity or maximum sustainable population size (K parameter)
  • simulation_time (optional, default: 24): Total time to simulate in hours
  • time_step (optional, default: 0.1): Time step for numerical integration in hours

Biological Use Case

Valuable for microbiology research including:

  • Predicting bacterial population dynamics in infection models
  • Optimizing antibiotic treatment timing and dosing strategies
  • Understanding bacterial colonization and persistence mechanisms
  • Modeling probiotic-pathogen competition dynamics
  • Analyzing growth kinetics in bioreactor systems
  • Studying host-pathogen interactions and immune responses
  • Designing bacterial biocontrol strategies

Output

Generates comprehensive modeling results including:

  • Time-series bacterial population trajectories
  • Growth phase identification (lag, exponential, stationary)
  • Maximum population density and time to reach equilibrium
  • Doubling time and generation time calculations
  • Graphical visualization of population dynamics
  • Model parameters and simulation summary
  • Detailed results report (growth_dynamics_results.txt)

Category

microbiology
